text: The food was very delicious. The waitress couldn't speak english so she brought us someone who could translate the menu as well. She helped us a lot actually. The only problem was that the pizza we ordered, one slice was slightly wet. The crust was soggy as if it had been dipped in water. But it was only a corner of the crust so I don't know what it could've been. Aside from that everything was good.

Pros:
- Great Food
- Good Ambiance
- Good Service

Cons:
- Price
- Portion on the petite side.

It's a bit pricey, and the portions are small. I had bruschetta, it was yummy. I had the vegetarian risotto, which was amazing! I spent $60, and the waitress forgot about me, waited nearly 30 minutes for her to pick up my payment. I had two glasses of wine and I'm a light weight so I hadn't noticed that much time had pasted, the book I was reading kept me entertained.

This is a sureshot in Longueuil. When you want to be sure that everybody will find something they like, I take them here.

I you have a dinner, I strongly suggest to site inside. The reason: to much traffic.

The service is always good.

L'endroit est magnifique. Autant extérieur qu'intérieur, l'ambiance et le décor a été bien pensé. Les employés sont courtois, nous étions un groupe privé de 35 personnes et c'était super. Nous avions la salle fermée au sous sol. Décor chaleureux et élégant. Le bar à pâtes était vraiment délicieux et le service très bien. L'ensemble est un peu dispendieux mais somme toute j'ai aimé l'expérience.

Bon mais... l'été sur la terrasse, savourer une pizza avec une bière en après midi ou en soirée avec des amis et la famille c'est magique et pour ça le Magia se mérite 4 étoile et mieux. Mais l'hiver à l'intérieur et pour le reste du menu, c'est très moyen.

Les plats n'impressionnent pas. Le fettucini  aux champignons goûtait trop soient la farine ou le fécule de maïs. C'est le cuisinier qui a manqué d'audace.

Le tiramisu en dessert devrait changer de nom tellement qu'il ne goûte pas et ressemble pas à ceux de la compétition. On dirait une version gâteau Vachon tellement le crémage blanc est à l'honneur.

Puis ma bière en fût était très flatte. Le barman et la serveuse n'ont pas remarqué l'absence de bulles et de collet.

En conclusion, le choix de l'administration d'engager une équipe moins expérimentée en restauration est un problème récurent qui me déçoit une fois de plus.

Oh Magia... You haven't aged well my friend. 

About 10 years ago I spent a year living a few blocks away from Magia. This was my favorite local eatery within a 5 min walk. 

A decade later, on a whim, I decided to return. It was kinda like running into an ex you haven't seen in a long time. A little fun for the first few minutes... but you're really left with "wow... What happened to her?". Sure the implants and Botox have helped, but it's just masking what once was. 

The menu looks the same, but dementia has set in, they have forgotten how to make my old favorites. I started with the warm goat cheese salad. I used to dream of this salad at night! But what I got was, well, it was disheartening. 

Anyway... I won't be calling her back. It was too awkward, and I don't see it getting better over the next few years either.

Pour un jeudi midi ensoleillé la terrasse du Magia n'était pas très occupée, surprenant... Inquiétant même. L'hôtesse n'a ma pas aidée a me rassurer mais la serveuse a été plus que charmante, mignonne, efficace et souriante. Le Virgin Ceaser et la bière rousse de mon invité étaient généreux et rafraîchissants. Ma salade italienne était goûteuse et croustillante, et les penne forestier délicieux!

Seul hic sur la terrasse de gauche... Plusieurs guèpes alors... Peureux s'abstenir!!

In the city of Longueuil, which is across the water from Montreal in what is called the south shore area, is the quaint old town area of Longueuil. This little strip is dotted with little shops and restaurants, including this one, La Magia. 

The restaurant is in a sort of old house, with the front room cleared out for diners. The food is casual, and good for lunch, offering salads, pastas, and pizzas. I had a nice Spaghetti Pancetta, which included a nice side salad, for $11.95, very reasonable and done well. Service in the busy lunch hour was good, too.

Un de mes restos préférés ! De bons repas goûteux et de bonnes portions pour les prix! Le menu change quelques fois mais ils sont toujours d'accord pour nous faire les anciens plats qu'on aimait tant!

ATMOSPHERE: Its a beautiful restaurant both inside and out. I loved eating here in the summer on the terrasse. The hanging lights and decor are lovely and the ambiance is great.

FOOD: The food was ok. It wasn't the best I've ever had and the pastas seem to be swimming in oil which I was definitely not a fan of. Taste-wise, it was decent. Portions are on the smaller side in my opinion as well. It didn't fill me up which was disappointing. 

PRICE: Its slightly expensive but not too bad. However, for the size that you're getting, it's not too worth it. 

SERVICE: The service was good but they were slow. I find that the staff is more French than English but that's to be expected in the South Shore.
